description: to have the same opinion
the scientific study of the universe and of objects that exist naturally in space, such as the moon, the sun, planets, and stars
a state where things are of equal weight or force
knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing
without any clothes or not covered by anything
the bottom part of an object, on which it rests, or the lowest part of something
in addition to; also
the organ inside the head that controls thought, memory, feelings, and activity
a part of something larger
a space surrounded on all sides by bars or wire, in which animals or birds are kept
an area of sand or small stones near the sea or another area of water such as a lake
peaceful, quiet, and without worry
the job or series of jobs that you do during your working life, especially if you continue to get better jobs and earn more money
US spelling of centre
to crush food into smaller, softer pieces with the teeth so that it can be swallowed
one of the sharp curved nails at the end of each of the toes of some animals and birds
a high area of rock with a very steep side, often on a coast
the point, area, or line that is formed by the meeting of two lines, surfaces, roads, etc.
a large group of people who have come together
interested in learning about people or things around you
slightly wet, especially in a way that is not pleasant or comfortable
A dangerous person, animal, thing, or activity could harm you
the period in the day when light from the sun begins to appear in the sky
going or being a long way down from the top or surface, or being of a particular distance from the top to the bottom
to completely destroy a building, especially in order to use the land for something else
to make or draw plans for something, for example clothes or buildings
to throw something away or get rid of it because you no longer want or need it
a rounded roof on a building or a room, or a building with such a roof
(a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is
twelve
the planet third in order of distance from the sun, between Venus and Mars; the world on which we live
a person who hates or opposes another person and tries to harm them or stop them from doing something
used when you are giving or asking for information that is completely correct
an amount that is more than acceptable, expected, or reasonable
a building or set of buildings where large amounts of goods are made using machines
known and recognized by many people
to stay on the surface of a liquid and not sink
an area of land, used for growing crops or keeping animals, usually surrounded by a fence
after a long time or some difficulty
new or different
to make someone feel fear
a substance that is used to provide heat or power, usually by being burned
an empty space or opening in the middle of something or between two things
to look at something or someone for a long time, especially in surprise or admiration, or because you are thinking about something else
a present or something that is given
the force that attracts objects towards one another, especially the force that makes things fall to the ground
physical or other injury or damage
a large group of animals of the same type that live and feed together
a suggestion or plan for doing something
a type of very small animal with six legs, a body divided into three parts and usually two pairs of wings, or, more generally, any similar very small animal
an object, such as a piano, guitar, or drum, that is played to produce musical sounds
to design and/or create something that has never been made before
a person in control of a group, country, or situation
from, existing in, serving, or responsible for a small area, especially of a country
unhappy because you are not with other people
great comfort, especially as provided by expensive and beautiful things
an event in which a large number of people walk through a public place to express their support for something, or their disagreement with or disapproval of something
to speak about something quickly, giving little detail or using few words
a device that changes electricity or fuel into movement and makes a machine work
worried and anxious

material made of threads of rope, string, wire, or plastic with spaces between them, allowing gas, liquid, or small objects to go through, or an object made with this material that is used to limit the movement of something
to eat something by taking a lot of small bites
to see or become conscious of something or someone
a very large area of sea
to put something into a bag, box, etc.
used to describe a person's face or skin if it has less colour than usual, for example when the person is or ill or frightened, or if it has less colour than people generally have
a large number of people walking or in vehicles, all going in the same direction, usually as part of a public celebration of something
in or to a position that is further than a particular point
the highest, strongest, or best point, value, or level of skill
an extremely large, round mass of rock and metal, such as Earth, or of gas, such as Jupiter, that moves in a circular path around the sun or another star
something that you are given, without asking for it, on a special occasion, especially to show friendship, or to say thank you
a fact or piece of information that shows that something exists or is true
If a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it
not in danger or likely to be harmed
a person who studies a subject in great detail, especially at a university
a large mammal that eats fish and lives partly in the sea and partly on land or ice
to look somewhere carefully in order to find something
to reach a decision or an agreement about something, or to end a disagreement
to have or use something at the same time as someone else
When people or animals shiver, they shake slightly because they feel cold, ill, or frightened
an ability to do an activity or job well, especially because you have practised it
having a surface or consisting of a substance that is perfectly regular and has no holes, lumps, or areas that rise or fall suddenly
the material on the surface of the ground in which plants grow
happening in a smooth, gradual, and regular way, not suddenly or unexpectedly
a thin thread of something, often one of a few, twisted around each other to make a string or rope
water that flows naturally along a fixed route formed by a channel cut into rock or ground, usually at ground level
a cylinder-shaped device for making objects that are far away look closer and larger, using a combination of lenses, or lenses and curved mirrors
a number of people or animals who do something together as a group
a tall, narrow structure, often square or circular, that either forms part of a building or stands alone
to make a journey, usually over a long distance
to shake slightly, usually because you are cold, frightened, or very emotional
a group of houses and other buildings that is smaller than a town, usually in the countryside
not physically strong
rich
to speak very quietly, using the breath but not the voice, so that only the person close to you can hear you
having or showing the ability to make good judgments, based on a deep understanding and experience of life
to think about problems or unpleasant things that might happen in a way that makes you feel unhappy and frightened
a unit of measurement equal to three feet or approximately 91.4 centimetres
a line or pattern that looks like a Z or a row of Zs joined together
